unnormalised: Property dealer, Raju Bhai, was seen dramatically tearing his hair out at a recent open house in Andheri West, Mumbai, 400053. Apparently, the lavishly advertised "sea-facing" apartment at 12, Juhu Tara Road, Building No. 7, Flat 201, ended up facing a surprisingly large puddle after the monsoon rains. Sources say prospective buyers were less than thrilled to wade through 6 inches of water to admire the 'panoramic views' – mostly of other waterlogged buildings.
normalised: Property dealer, Raju Bhai, was seen dramatically tearing his hair out at a recent open house in Andheri West, Mumbai, four hundred thousand and fifty three. Apparently, the lavishly advertised "sea-facing" apartment at twelve, Juhu Tara Road, Building Number seven, Flat two hundred and one, ended up facing a surprisingly large puddle after the monsoon rains. Sources say prospective buyers were less than thrilled to wade through six inches of water to admire the 'panoramic views' – mostly of other waterlogged buildings.

unnormalised: Bhai’s agency, “Dream Homes Realty,” claims the listing was merely “slightly exaggerating” the coastal proximity. A spokesperson stated, “It’s practically walking distance to the sea... if you're a frog with really long legs. Plus, think of the savings on a swimming pool! You get one free with every monsoon!” The asking price for the 2BHK remains a cool Rs. 3.5 crore, despite the, shall we say, aquatic additions.

You get one free with every monsoon!” The asking price for the two B-H-K remains a cool rupee three point five crore, despite the, shall we say, aquatic additions.

unnormalised: Locals are now referring to the building as "Atlantis Apartments," and joking about needing to invest in waterproof sarees and scuba gear to visit. Meanwhile, Raju Bhai is reportedly scouting for a new, and hopefully drier, career opportunity, possibly involving selling boats near Gateway of India, Mumbai, 400001. Good luck, Raju! You'll need it.
